citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An adult blue and white budgerigar is unable to fly and displays a slightly extended and drooping left wing. At the time of
inspection, the bird was standing on the floor of the indoor-housing facility near a tray of food where it and other birds
were eating. The bird is unable to extend it's left wing and the condition does not appear new or acutely painful. This
abnormality had not been previously noticed by the facility and thus the bird's abnormal condition had not been relayed to
the Attending Veterinarian.
Correct by ensuring daily observation of all animals to assess their health and well-being and that timely and accurate
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian. Correct by
December 15, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan for birds. An environmental enhancement plan must be
developed, documented, and approved by the attending veterinarian so as to promote the health and psychological well-
being of birds.
Correct by ensuring that a complete, documented plan for environmental enhancement, that addresses the required
elements approved by the attending veterinarian, is maintained and available for inspection. Correct by January 31, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
